text:
@Go_Cackletta @aires_aston neurodiversity theory should come fairly intuitively to anarchists, but the real challenges are:

1) internalized ableism

2) having to treat people as individuals

3) not making assumptions

4) communicating early, often, honestly, assertively, without making things personal

text:
Neurodivergence (def):
A functional neurological difference in which individuals experience systemic discrimination for non-compliance with the status quo (i.e. neurotypical).  

Conflated with disability as a means to protect existing societal structures. #Neurodiversity

text:
Neurodivergence (def):
Natural, functional variant in neurological makeup.  Often predisposes individuals to seek meaning, see holistically, have heightened senses, and question status quo.

#Neurodiversity

text:
World Media: STOP catastrophizing Autism Spectrum Conditions. 

It is unfair to those on the spectrum! We don't struggle because of our Neurodiverse condition. We "struggle" because the world was not made for Neurodiversity. So if you want to help, make the world more accessible.

text: Neurodivergent isn't just a synonym for autistic. Neurodiversity encompasses any neurological disorder, including dyspraxia, dyslexia, Tourette's, and ADHD. The direct opposite of autistic is not neurotypical (although you can't be both NT and autistic) but allistic.

An advantage the neurodiversity movement has is being able to look back, learn from history, and see what worked. 

1. Reclaiming words. 
2. Pride.
3. Professing dignity, showing ability.
4. A message of 'see us as human, too'.

More? https://t.co/cVu46LZ4Dw

text:
I know it's meant to be empowering and I get the logic when people say neurodiversity is not an illness

But like...I have really complicated feelings as an Autistic person who is chronically ill about the implication that an illness means there's something wrong with you

text:
One strength of kids with #ADHD is that they possess ''neoteny'' (Latin for ''holding youth''). That is, they act younger than their years. We call it ''immaturity'' but its actually a positive development in the evolution of species.  #neurodiversity

https://t.co/VGqcIGdjjK https://t.co/hScP9a4ADa

text:
Sometimes I wonder if I have a Twitter brand.

Then I remember I'm making this up as I go along, and start rambling about #autism or my #cat.

Or try to be a writer.

Special interests and nerd crushes shamelessly retweeted.

Is that a brand?

#WritingCommunity #Neurodiversity

text:
I am grateful to be a mother-but it has never been easy.

Full of disability (mine+kids), neurodiversity (mine/partner/kids), infant loss, trauma and late-realised LGBTQ identities, there was no manual for this.

But listening to my kids chat with one another today? Wondrous!

I wish neurodiversity was more readily accepted in the workplace.

text:
We're often asked about ND terminology - here's what we go with:
- Neurodiversity: the concept of different brain types & thinking
- Neurodiverse: different brain types in a group or population
- Neurodivergent: an atypical brain, eg. autistic or ADHD - opposite of neurotypical
